document_data.name: Kanabar
document_data.mainbody:
'''Kanabar''' was a [[beholder]] that dwelled within the [[Greypeak Mountains]] during the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]]. 

{{Quote|You wouldn't lie to poor Kanabar would you? Not when Kanabar told the others he had a use for you?|Kanabar, to his "friend" Aris.}}
document_data.History:
Kanabar was among those beholders enthralled by the [[phaerimm]] that escaped from the [[Sharn Wall]] within the depths of the [[Shaeradim]] in the {{YearlinkName|1371}}. The eye tyrants were ordered to hunt down the [[Shadovar]] sorcerer [[Melegaunt Tanthul]] and then wipe out the [[stone giant]] settlement of [[Thousand Faces]] in the Greypeaks.

During the takeover of Thousand Faces, Kanabar ''[[charm]]ed'' a lone giant by the name of [[Aris (giant)|Aris]], sparing his life from its fellow beholders. Some time later, the [[elven]] warrior [[Galaeron Nihmedu]] rescued Aris and incapacitated Kanabar with a shadowy, gum-like material, and used its own anti-magic ray to undo the charm placed upon him. Finally freed, the stone giant gripped the devious floating eye in his palm and smashed it on the cliff side like a ripe [[melon]].
